trans-unit.source: It is a good start to write in lower case. If you have a question please use the questionmark (?) at the end. Please try to use full words. Instead of "it's" please use "it is" You can search my website with "search": search extbase root Use "open" to load a page with a given UID: open 123 Converter. Currently md5, sha1, crc32, password_hash are supported: convert md5 myValue Ping a host: ping typo3lexikon.de Show command. Currently cookies, timestamp, date, time, datetime are supported: show date You don't like cookies? Call: delete all cookies Start a calculation if you enter integer/float and signs like +-*/(): 1+2-3 *5 /(2*3)
Yeah. I'm fine. Thank you
Just a little bit above 30
I come from Lindlar. That's here in Germany
My name ist Stefan
Boss? I'm the boss of this website
My boss is Jochen Weiland
I'm working at jweiland.net
Yeah! A "typo" was the beginning of the new name of TYPO3. Do you want to know a little bit more about that? https://typo3.org/about/the-brand/about-the-name/
TYPO3 is an open source content management system and will be always written in upper case
I love TYPO3. It's the best CMS I have ever used
You can download TYPO3 CMS from here: https://typo3.org/download/ If you have SSH access you can download TYPO3 CMS also by wget or by curl: https://get.typo3.org/
You can install TYPO3 CMS with "composer create-project typo3/cms-base-distribution CmsBaseDistribution". But please have a look at http://composer.typo3.org/ for more information
In this repository you will find all TYPO3 packages available for composer integration: https://composer.typo3.org/satis.html

TemplaVoila seems to be dead. Alexander Schnitzler and Wouter Woulter have updated TemplaVoila for 6.2. But in case of the new Backend API of TYPO3 it seems to be very hard to update TemplaVoila for TYPO3 7 and higher. Please use something else like Fluid Content Elements which has much more acceptance and more performance.
https://docs.typo3.org/typo3cms/TyposcriptReference/
https://docs.typo3.org/typo3cms/TyposcriptReference/Setup/Page/Index.html
https://docs.typo3.org/typo3cms/TyposcriptReference/Setup/Config/Index.html
https://docs.typo3.org/typo3cms/TyposcriptReference/Functions/Stdwrap/Index.html
https://docs.typo3.org/typo3cms/TyposcriptReference/Functions/Typolink/Index.html
https://docs.typo3.org/typo3cms/TSconfigReference/
https://docs.typo3.org/typo3cms/TSconfigReference/PageTsconfig/Index.html
https://docs.typo3.org/typo3cms/TSconfigReference/UserTsconfig/Index.html
Joomla is an interesting CMS, but for me it was listed a bit too often on https://www.exploit-db.com
A pretty good blog system, but not really a professional CMS like TYPO3
What? Do you really use that old CMS? It wasn't supported anymore. Switch to a newer one like TYPO3 CMS

Wow. That's pretty a long time ago I have tried to install it. 7 years ago? I remember: After 2 days I have stopped trying to install it and have never touched it again. It wasn't based on PHP, isn't it?
Available since 2000 and completely written in Java. I'm not a Java professional. I love PHP and I love TYPO3 CMS.
Papaya? Can I eat this?
They have cleaned up their API, but they have broken their Backwardscompatibility. So maybe you can build up your extension again.
Available since 2007 and programmed on Python.
Yes, I was married since Juli 2009
The name of my wife is Petra
My hair color is black
The color of my eyes is green
My hobby is working with TYPO3 CMS and annoying my wife
Petra is just 2 years younger than me
Hmmm...would be a cool feature. Let me check some public APIs for that...
It's just because of fun. But currently it helps me a lot to reorganize my website. Maybe I will remove that feature in future.
Sorry. Don't know. But you can try "show my ip" if it will help you ;-)
Sorry. Don't know. But you can try "show my ip" if it will help you ;-)
